summary: A statement from an anonymous victim (Jane Doe) represented by attorney Gloria Allred, describing an alleged sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein during what she believed was a modeling audition at his New York mansion. The statement includes details of the assault, intimidation by Epstein's staff, and mentions of his powerful connections.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Owner of Victoria's Secret (as presented to the victim) who allegedly sexually assaulted the victim during a supposed modeling audition in his New York mansion office.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing the anonymous victim (Jane Doe) who prepared and released this statement.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned by a girl outside Epstein's office as one of the powerful people Epstein knew, used to intimidate the victim into compliance.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Anonymous victim who was a model from another country, lured to Epstein's mansion for a supposed Victoria's Secret modeling audition where she was allegedly sexually assaulted.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly sexually assaulted Jane Doe during a meeting she believed was a modeling audition.
A girl outside Epstein's office stated Epstein knew Bill Clinton, suggesting a social or professional connection.
Gloria Allred is the attorney representing Jane Doe, as indicated in the statement header.

events.title: Alleged Assault at Epstein's Mansion
events.description: Jane Doe meets Jeffrey Epstein in his New York mansion office for what she believes is a Victoria's Secret modeling audition. Epstein allegedly removes his robe, gets physically close to her, and attempts to assault her while she is trapped in a locked room.

events.title: Release of Victim Statement
events.description: Attorney Gloria Allred releases a statement from Jane Doe detailing her alleged assault by Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The victim was lured to Epstein's New York mansion under the false pretense of a Victoria's Secret modeling audition.
Epstein allegedly locked the victim in his office, removed his robe, and attempted to sexually assault her.
Epstein's staff intimidated the victim by stating Epstein knew powerful people like Bill Clinton and could ruin her career if she didn't comply.
The victim's statement was prepared and released by prominent attorney Gloria Allred on August 27, 2019.
